title: ICC Hearing: Surya told to refrain from making political comments as skipper pleads ‘not guilty’ for Pahalgam comments
description: Earlier, India had filed an official complaint with the ICC against Pakistan cricketers Rauf and Farhan for their provocative gestures during the two sides' Asia Cup Super 4 game here last Sunday

title: The Right to be cool in a sweltering South
description: Access to air conditioning is currently severely limited in developing countries, including in India. Enhancing this access is urgently required as a public health safeguard and a necessity for adaptation to climate change. Cooling is no longer a matter of comfort for the global South, but a frontline adaptation need

title: Why India’s urban definition is failing its growing towns
description: In the 2011 Census, an urban unit was defined as either a statutory town or a census town

title: Citizens, domicile, and migrants: Why we should worry about Provincial Citizenship
description: Provincial citizenship emerges from nativist politics rooted in an emotional belonging to a State, which gains immediate leverage in regional electoral politics. It challenges the idea of singular Indian citizenship, sparking debates over definitions of ‘native’, ‘indigenous’, ‘Adivasi’, ‘local’, or ‘son of the soil’

title: Telangana CM to hand over Group-I appointment orders on September 27
description: Chief Secretary K. Ramakrishna Rao reviewed the arrangements in a tele-conference with senior officials

title: ED questions actor Jagapati Babu in Sahiti Infra fraud probe
description: The ED collected details of the remuneration and payment methods received by the actor for appearing in promotional campaigns of Sahiti Infra

title: HMR Phase 1 handover likely next year as L&T’s 15-year Metro journey nears end
description: Despite financial losses, L&TMRH is credited with running a tight and efficient operation, maintaining clean infrastructure, minimal breakdowns, and high service frequency

title: The Ba***ds of Bollywood: Aryan Khan’s debut show lacks a ‘lakshya’
Landed in Mumbai with Rs 30 and ‘starved’ in a chawl: Dev Anand let go of a high paying job for cinema dreams
Exclusive | Mahesh Bhatt feels wife Soni Razdan a better actor than daughter Alia Bhatt: ‘If you feel there’s no better actor than you, watch your mom’s film’
Counting on change
description: The Karnataka government’s survey of gender minorities, which commenced on September 15 across all 31 districts, has given hope to a large community that has been pushed to the shadows for long. Community members tell Shilpa Elizabeth that it shows the way forward, despite some concerns

title: Rains LIVE: Bengal, Odisha on high alert for heavy rains as low-pressure system forms over Bay of Bengal
description: The Southwest monsoon is not expected to withdraw from Maharashtra before October 5 due to the low-pressure system

title: Trump hosts Turkiye's Erdogan at U.S. considers lifting a ban on F-35 sales to NATO ally
description: The President, in a brief exchange with reporters as he bid farewell to Mr. Erdogan, called it a “good meeting” but did not offer further details

‘Neeraj is a speed thrower, needs to return to his strengths’: Javelin legend Uwe Hohn

description: Chennai Kaalpandhu League provides training and visibility to children with a passion for football, training and visibility, and but most importantly, gives them the courage to dream big

title: Rajasthan man accused of spying for Pakistan held, fourth such arrest in Jaisalmer this year
As high as 70% of cancers in India may be attributable to modifiable risk factors: AIIMS oncologist and Lancet study collaborator flags priorities for prevention

description: The District Collector of Thiruvananthapuram declared a holiday for educational institutions, including professional colleges, in the district and IMD cautioned fishers from putting their boats out to sea

At centre of first ‘I Love Mohammad’ FIR, residents of Kanpur neighbourhood say: ‘Displayed banner last year too, what is our crime?’
Court rules in Riley Gaines’ favor in case against transgender athletes in women’s sports
description: Riley Gaines has secured a legal win. This is regarding transgender athletes in women's sports. A federal judge allowed Title IX claims against the NCAA to proceed. The lawsuit challenges NCAA policies. These policies allowed transgender athletes to compete in women's competitions. The controversy stems from the 2022 Championships. Lia Thomas, a biological male, competed in women’s events.

title: ‘Leader of Opposition kisses sister in public’: Kailash Vijayvargiya’s remark invites Congress criticism
Crowd storms home of Zubeen Garg’s manager, pelts stones at police vehicles in Guwahati

Derek O’Brien writes: Books will survive the AI invasion, if their fate is in the hands of women
Best of Both Sides: UGC’s draft curriculum pairs contemporary Mathematics with civilisational literacy
Man who fired on ICE facility hated U.S. government, sought to kill federal agents, say officials
description: The gunman, who fatally shot himself, left behind a note saying that he hoped the attack would “give ICE agents real terror,” said the FBI director

title: Best of Both Sides: UGC’s draft Mathematics curriculum will make students less capable
September 26, 1985, Forty Years Ago: Cabinet Reshuffle
Column by Saba Mahjoor | When two sisters split a village
description: And Phuphee wished she could pound some sense into them, almost like lotus stems for nadir monjyi

Not to be braggadocious, but here’s another Trumpism
Irregularities at National Skill Development Corporation must be addressed urgently

Ladakh violence: J&K CM Abdullah defends Congress, accuses BJP of blaming others for its failures
description: Mr. Abdullah said the Lieutenant Governor-led Ladakh administration should see why it failed in the first place to take necessary measures to maintain peace

title: Rajasthan man arrested on charges of espionage for Pakistan in Jaisalmer
description: Rajasthan CID Intelligence arrests Hanif Khan, a suspected Pakistani spy, for allegedly sharing confidential Indian Army information with Pakistan’s intelligence agency

title: Shah lands in Kolkata to attend Puja; BJP appoints Bhupendra Yadav as poll in-charge
Morning Digest: Leh remains tense a day after death of four persons; Trump says he will not allow Israel to annex the West Bank, and more
description: Here is a select list of stories to start the day.

title: Trump holds talks with Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif
description: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif was among the top officials from eight Arab or Muslim countries who met with Mr. Trump on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly this week to discuss strategy on ending the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza.

title: 100% on pharma products, 50% on kitchen cabinets: Trump rolls out new round of tariffs — Check list
description: Donald Trump announced significant tariffs on various goods, effective October 1st, 2025. A 100% tariff will be imposed on branded pharmaceuticals unless companies begin manufacturing in the US. Additionally, tariffs of 50% on kitchen cabinets and bathroom vanities, 30% on upholstered furniture, and 25% on heavy trucks aim to protect domestic industries.

title: Asia Cup: Pakistani fan goes viral shaking hands with Haris Rauf - Watch
description: A viral video of a Pakistani fan's provocative message to Haris Rauf has intensified the India-Pakistan rivalry ahead of the Asia Cup final. This incident, coupled with previous controversial gestures from Pakistani players, has fueled the tension. While Pakistan's captain asserts their team's ability, India aims to win and demonstrate that sportsmanship triumphs over theatrics and provocation.

title: Imperfect postures | Review of Fascist Yoga by Stewart Home
description: How Indian or Hindu is yoga? A new book presents another origin story

title: A place linked to soldiers for long
description: The Defence Services Staff College was relocated from Quetta, Pakistan, to Wellington only after Independence. But the Nilgiris had a long association with soldiers. The British opened a depot in the mountains for its regiments to convalesce in 1862

title: Time is running out for the dolmens of Kodaikanal dating back to 5,000 years
description: Only less than 50% of the dolmens, recorded by Reverend A. Anglade S.J. and Reverend L. V. Newton S.J., are standing in the hills. At Pethuparai, dolmens have been fenced by the Archaeological Survey of India. At Thandikudi, they are vanishing, and some have disappeared under thick vegetation. More measures are needed to preserve them

title: A rare custom continues: deities are taken to Thiruvananthapuram from  Kanniyakumari
description: A few days before the Navaratri celebrations, a spectacular event takes place in Kanniyakumari district, once part of the erstwhile Travancore. Its history dates back to more than 200 years. Even today, it reminds the local people of the strong cultural bonds between Tamil Nadu and Kerala beyond political boundaries

title: Terrorism ‘persistent threat’ to development: EAM Jaishankar
description: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar emphasises the need to combat terrorism and reform multilateralism for global stability and development

title: Trump announces new tariffs on pharmaceuticals, heavy trucks and kitchen cabinets from October 1
Five arrested in 2021 ITBP recruitment paper leak case
Projects worth Rs 1,000 crore cleared for Delhi villages
BMW crash: People wanted to help the deceased, but accused refused, police tell court
Column | Let’s play a game
description: Experimenting with form and genre, these page-turners invite readers to join in on the fun

title: Sagittarius Horoscope Today, 26 September 2025: Emotional tides run high
Taurus Horoscope Today, 26 September 2025: Your seniors expect more from you
Three-day survey on dragonflies begins at seven biodiversity parks in the Capital

WRD fast-tracks dredging of Central Buckingham Canal ahead of northeast monsoon
description: The ₹31-crore project covers dredging of the 7.3-km stretch between Sivananda Salai and R.A. Puram to improve the canal’s flood carrying capacity up to 2,500 cubic feet per second

title: Women’s ODI World Cup | How girls from small towns are rewriting India’s cricket narrative
description: More than half of India’s 15-member squad will be making their World Cup debut; these youngsters inspire a cultural shift, greater visibility and heftier pay checks

title: Capricorn Horoscope Today, 26 September 2025: Starting or expanding a business may be on your mind today
Aquarius Horoscope Today, 26 September 2025: Stay emotionally available, even from afar

Shah Rukh Khan and Hrithik Roshan’s dentist says glucose biscuits are more harmful than chocolates for teeth: ‘Most dangerous’
Not ‘only’ a nail infection
description: Any sudden nail discoloration should be examined by a dermatologist. Some nail issues may be symptoms of larger health problems

title: Why does sadness cause us to shed tears?
Act of resistance | Review of Dapaan by Ipsita Chakravarty
description: Chakravarty gathers stories from places in Kashmir before they are erased

title: Muscle matters: rethinking obesity with resistance training
description: Strength training plus a calorie-smart diet trims waistlines and powers up metabolic and mental health

title: Commerce Department at Ethiraj College for Women celebrates its golden jubilee
Three youths killed in road accident near Chengam
Mass cleanup drive at Fort garden, parapet wall in Vellore
Police seize four tonnes of PDS rice at Jolarpet railway station
UPSC meet to finalise panel of three DGPs today
description: One among them will be appointed to head Tamil Nadu police

title: Chennai’s residential market shows signs of positive growth
India's forest cover expanded by mere 2.5% in 10 yrs but 'very dense' cover grew 22.7%
description: India's forest cover saw a modest 2.5% increase between 2010-11 and 2021-22, with a significant 22.7% surge in very dense forests, signaling successful conservation. While moderately dense forests experienced a decline, open forests also expanded. The government's report highlights improved forest condition regarding biomass and carbon storage, but warns of regeneration challenges and fire risks.

title: NGT bars construction activity around Pallikaranai Marshland until a scientific study is conducted
description: The bench ordered that construction activity should be put on halt within one kilometre of the Pallikaranai Marshland until a study identifying the wetland’s zone of influence is completed

title: Kolkata electrocution deaths: Calcutta HC seeks response from government, KMC and CESC
description: Even after 48 hours of deluge, certain areas in Kolkata remained waterlogged and without power supply. Residents of Utsav Utsarg Apartment in Ward No. 109 of the Kolkata Municipal Corporation have been left without power since Tuesday morning.

title: Ensure day-to-day trials in criminal cases, SC tells HCs
description: The Supreme Court has directed high courts to ensure day-to-day trials in criminal cases, especially sensitive ones, citing concerns about delays and the current social and political climate. The court expressed disappointment over the abandonment of continuous trials, which were common three decades ago.

title: ‘Degrees’ from US varsity, Chaitanyananda books ‘endorsed’ by Steve Jobs, Obama under scanner
Asia Cup: Massive statement! Pakistan captain drops bombshell on India ahead of final
description: Pakistan clinched a narrow 11-run victory against Bangladesh in a Super 4s Asia Cup match, securing their place in the final against India. Captain Salman Ali Agha praised his team's exceptional quality, highlighting Shaheen Shah Afridi's all-round performance. Bangladesh's captain, Jaker Ali, attributed their loss to poor batting, despite commendable bowling efforts.

title: Trump says U.S. will impose new tariffs on heavy trucks, drugs and kitchen cabinets
description: The reason for this is the large scale “FLOODING” of these products into the United States by other outside Countries, says U.S. President Donald Trump

title: On 80-yr-old's plea, SC orders eviction of his 61-yr-old son
description: The Supreme Court intervened in a poignant case, ordering a 61-year-old man to vacate his elderly parents' Mumbai properties. The octogenarian couple sought relief under the Maintenance and Welfare of Senior Citizens Act after their son failed to provide mandated support.

title: AI hallucination: Plea in Delhi HC cites ‘false’ case laws, withdrawn
Mohan Majhi government plans to strengthen cooperative movement in Odisha in a big way
description: Creation of unified marketing brand—under the name of either Utkal or Kalinga—to promote Odisha’s products in international markets has been mooted

title: School dropout rates halved in 2 years, says govt report
description: India's school system is showing remarkable progress, with dropout rates significantly declining across all levels, according to a recent MoSPI survey. The survey highlights that dropout rates have nearly halved in just two years, especially at the preparatory and middle school levels. Experts attribute this positive shift to government initiatives like expanded mid-day meals and infrastructure improvements.

title: 'Serious crimes': Ex-FBI director James Comey indicted
PM Modi to officials: Don't wait for me, fix project delays
description: Prime Minister Modi has directed top bureaucrats and state chief secretaries to proactively address infrastructure project delays, rather than waiting for central intervention. During a Pragati meeting, he inquired about disciplinary actions against responsible officials.

title: Asia Cup: ‘Put them under pressure' - Pak coach fires stern warning to India before final clash
description: Pakistan's coach, Mike Hesson, has urged his team to concentrate on cricket ahead of their historic Asia Cup final against India, despite recent controversies and heightened tensions. India has dominated recent encounters, winning both matches in the tournament and holding a seven-match winning streak against Pakistan.

title: SIT questions Zubeen Garg drummer; homes searched
description: Assam police are investigating the death of singer Zubeen Garg, questioning his drummer and searching homes following public outrage and multiple FIRs. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma recalled his past warnings about the exploitation of the singer by those close to him.

title: MCG Commissioner asks Sohna civic body to draft plan for waste-to-wonder park
Delhi Confidential: Healing Words
Maha Periyava’s might
Cardi B’s alleged affair with Stefon Diggs while 8 months pregnant with offset
description: Cardi B's personal life is again making headlines as she confirms her pregnancy with Stefon Diggs. This news has resurfaced rumors of flirtatious exchanges with Diggs during her previous marriage to Offset, adding a layer of controversy to their relationship. Despite past allegations and a divorce, both Cardi and Offset express a desire for peace and moving forward.

title: India ties hit as it backs & hosts Hasina: Muhammad Yunus
description: Muhammad Yunus criticized India for supporting Sheikh Hasina, alleging it strained relations due to India's disapproval of student protests against her. He accused Hasina of crimes and requested her extradition, while also dismissing reports of rising Islamic fundamentalism in Bangladesh as false. Yunus further suggested India was hindering SAARC's progress, emphasizing the need for regional cooperation.

title: Trinamool, BJP feud over rainfall data after Kolkata’s deadly downpour
description: As Trinamool cites ‘cumulative’ figure of 1423.2mm of ‘overnight rainfall’, the BJP alleges misrepresentation of rainfall data and a ‘PR circus’

title: US-Pak ties: Trump meets Shehbaz Sharif, Asim Munir; praises leaders
description: Donald Trump met with Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and army chief Asim Munir, praising them as "great leaders." This meeting, following a recent trade deal and a brief encounter at the UN, signals a shift in Trump's stance towards Pakistan. Trump also emphasized Pakistan's strategic importance in Afghanistan, particularly regarding the Bagram Air Base.

title: Trade show a platform to showcase UP before country: Yogi Adityanath
Southern Railway introduces Janata Khana scheme in Chennai
description: An official says the scheme is aimed at helping unreserved passengers purchase meals without leaving the platform at an affordable price of ₹20; currently, the scheme is operated in 27 stations

title: ‘Better to die than face this’: 73-yr-old deported after 30 yrs in US
description: Harjit Kaur, a 73-year-old woman who lived in the US for 30 years, faced deportation after her asylum applications were denied. During her detention, she was allegedly denied proper medical care, food, and basic hygiene.

title: FBI ex-chief James Comey criminally charged as Trump targets critics, source says
description: U.S. President Trump fired Mr. Comey in 2017, early in the Republican President's first term in office.

title: 'Charlie helped me a lot!': Trump hails TikTok; credits late MAGA star for campaign use
description: Donald Trump approved a deal for TikTok. American investors will take over the platform. Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison is involved. Trump mentioned Charlie Kirk's influence on his TikTok use. ByteDance will retain a minority stake. US investors will control the algorithm. The deal awaits final investor determination. Oracle will play a significant role.

title: Day 1 of GST cut: 6-fold surge in credit card online payments to Rs 10,000 crore
India’s chief negotiator back after ‘productive’ meet; H-1B separate from trade: US official
Threatening development cannot facilitate peace: Jaishankar at G20
Of 4 who died in Leh, 3 in early 20s: ‘They had multiple bullet wounds on torso and head’
Banks should work to be in global top 10, fund small & medium firms: Amit Shah
PM Modi says investors prefer India for diversity, demand & scale
After acquittal in Malegaon case, Lt Col Prasad Purohit promoted to Colonel
UGC draft curriculum ‘ideologically driven content’, says panel set up by Kerala govt
Six arrested in Amritsar with 4 k.g. heroin, 2 pistols: Punjab Police
description: Preliminary investigation revealed that the accused persons were in touch with a Pakistan-based handler named Shah through social media, the DGP said

title: Ahmedabad: 4 held on charge of gangraping 15-year-old girl
Russia accuses NATO, EU of waging 'real war' on it via Ukraine
description: Another clear example is the crisis in Ukraine provoked by the West, through which NATO and the EU have ... already declared a real war on my country and are directly involved in it, says Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov

title: Everyone believes they are match-winners now: Smriti Mandhana
description: India will hope to break the jinx of never winning a women's World Cup in the coming weeks, and they open their campaign against Sri Lanka in Guwahati on September 30

title: Paranjoy Guha Thakurta not liable to follow gag order on Adani reports till further order: Court
Diljit Dosanjh bags International Emmy nomination for ‘Amar Singh Chamkila’, film also gets a nod
description: Produced by Window Seat Films, the Netflix movie featured Dosanjh in the titular role of the Punjabi singer who was shot dead in 1988 with his singer-wife Amarjot, played by Parineeti Chopra

title: Just 5% of US staff on H-1B visas: Accenture
description: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet downplayed H-1B visa concerns, stating only 5% of their US workforce relies on them. The company's headcount decreased by 11,419 in Q4, part of a business optimization program involving talent rotation and divestitures. Despite this, FY25 revenue rose 7%, with growth across all verticals and geographies, and the operating margin expanded to 15.6%.

title: 'Haven’t liked it at all': Donald Trump slams Russia, Putin on Ukraine
description: Donald Trump voiced his disapproval of Russia's actions and Vladimir Putin's leadership. He highlighted Russia's economic struggles and called their war effort aimless. Trump mentioned potential Ukrainian reclamation of territory with EU and NATO support. He stated the US will continue providing weapons to NATO.

title: PM Modi: ‘We cannot afford to depend on anyone, must be self-reliant’
Congress MP writes to PM Modi on H-1B, seeks 5-year loan reprieve for students
Sanju leads Andhra Pradesh Amateur Golf Championship
description: Fellow Railways golfer Deepak Yadav shot a second straight 68 to stay a shot behind on 10-under 203. Overnight leader Sukhman Singh, however, failed to get going and slipped to the third spot

title: Keya has the last laugh despite a poor final round
description: Guntas Kaur Sandhu (74) finished as the runner-up, and Ceerat Kang, who shot a gritty one-under 71 under challenging conditions, came third on 15-over 231.

title: Step up lending for public infra, MSMEs: FM Sitharaman to banks
description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman urged banks with strong balance sheets to increase lending for public infrastructure, industry, and MSMEs, emphasizing their crucial role amid global uncertainty. She highlighted India's resilience due to strong economic fundamentals and urged public sector banks to maintain professional management and customer-centric approaches. The government is emphasizing increased capital for MSMEs to aid expansion and recovery.

title: Criminal law can't become means to settle scores: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court has cautioned against misusing criminal law to settle personal vendettas, criticizing the increasing trend of filing FIRs in civil disputes. The court emphasized the duty of High Courts to intervene and prevent the abuse of legal processes, particularly when criminal proceedings are used to exert pressure in civil matters.

title: Fifty years ago | 6670 M. bank notes at the end of March
Wankhede sues Aryan Khan's show for defamation
description: Sameer Wankhede, the former NCB zonal director, has filed a defamation suit in Delhi High Court against the makers of 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood,' a Netflix series directed by Aryan Khan. Wankhede seeks ₹2 crore in damages, alleging the series negatively portrays anti-drug enforcement and maligns his reputation.

title: Pay Rs 43 lakh with 18% interest for possession delay, SC tells builder
‘Graduates will be well prepared to use AI when classical Tamil pedagogy is combined with essential English skills’
Centre cancels FCRA licence of Wangchuk's NGO
description: The Union home ministry has cancelled the FCRA license of Sonam Wangchuk's NGO, Students Educational and Cultural Movement of Ladakh, citing alleged violations. These violations include depositing locally generated funds into the FCRA account, diverting funds for impermissible activities like studying the country's sovereignty, and failing to deposit foreign funds in the designated account.

title: ACJ launches Climate Change Media Hub in collaboration with German academy
Daily Horoscope for 26 September, 2025: Astrological Forecasts for Libra, Leo, Pisces, Aries, Sagittarius, and All Zodiac Signs
A hundred years ago | Burma and India
description: From September 25, 1925 edition as there was no September 26 edition

title: SC seeks Centre’s reply on plea seeking import curbs on yellow peas
J&K govt to give land to families hit by floods
Trump says he will not allow Israel to annex the West Bank
description: I will not allow Israel to annex the West Bank. I will not allow it. It’s not going to happen, says U.S. President Donald Trump

title: Team USA tries to grab Ryder Cup in front of home crowd
description: The United States team will try to seize the Ryder Cup back from Team Europe when the 45th playing of the competition begins Friday at Bethpage Black

title: Villagers oppose free housing plots allotted to transgender persons in Chengalpattu
Charlie Kirk’s harsh attacks on Taylor Swift resurface amid his death
description: Following Charlie Kirk's death, his old derogatory post targeting Taylor Swift has resurfaced. In 2018, Kirk criticized Swift for endorsing a Democrat and questioning Marsha Blackburn's stance on women's issues. Swift had openly opposed Blackburn's views on LGBTQ+ rights and women's rights. The resurfaced post has drawn attention amid the controversy surrounding Kirk's assassination.

title: Former Arsenal striker Billy Vigar dies after collapse at Wingate match
description: Football world mourns the tragic passing of 21-year-old Billy Vigar, a Chichester City striker and former Arsenal academy player. Vigar collapsed during a match against Wingate & Finchley, suffering a serious brain injury. Despite surgery, he passed away, prompting heartfelt tributes from Chichester City, Arsenal, Derby County, and across the football community.

title: Modi-Bibi ties have led to govt silence on 'genocide': Sonia Gandhi
description: Sonia Gandhi criticized India's silence on Palestine, attributing it to the personal friendship between PM Modi and Israeli PM Netanyahu, rather than India's values or interests. She argued that this personalized diplomacy undermines India's foreign policy and historical stance on freedom and human dignity. Sonia emphasized that silence equates to complicity.

title: 'Young people really wanted this': Trump approves TikTok deal with China; US takeover set
description: Donald Trump signed an executive order finalizing a deal allowing TikTok to operate in the US, with a majority stake moving to US investors like Oracle and Silver Lake. ByteDance will retain less than 20% equity. Much is still unknown about the actual arrangement, but Trump said Chinese President Xi Jinping “gave us the go-ahead” to proceed with the deal.

title: Outrage over infant deaths in Indore | In India’s cleanest city, rats in a hospital
description: Two infants died this September after rats bit them in the NICU of a government hospital in Indore, sparking outrage. However, the Madhya Pradesh government claims that the cause of death was pre-existing medical conditions. Mehul Malpani reports on the gaps in hygiene and safety standards in decades-old facilities and the overburdened public healthcare system in the State

title: IAEA says drone detonated near Ukraine's South Ukraine nuclear plant
description: The agency said its team at the site was informed that 22 drones were observed in the plant's monitoring zone late on Wednesday and early on Thursday, with some flying as close as 500 metres.

title: Dr Neil K Anand, who treated 9/11 patients, sentenced to 14 years in prison
description: Dr Anand and his family disputed the allegations and said his compassion for his patients was fairly criminalized. They said Dr Anand went to ground zero on the day of 9/11 attack when he was an intern and treated patients. "The government is using artificial intelligence and manipulated data to prosecute me for treating chronic pain patients, turning tools meant to help into weapons against doctors," Dr Anand said earlier.

title: Poor financial condition most dominant driver of child marriage, states report
description: A recent report indicates that poverty remains the primary driver of child marriage in India, although cases have declined in villages over the past three years. The study, conducted across five states, highlights that financial constraints, perceived need for protection, and cultural practices contribute to the issue.

title: Trump signs order declaring TikTok sale plan meets U.S. requirements
description: There was some resistance on the Chinese side, but the fundamental thing that we wanted to accomplish is that we wanted to keep TikTok operating, says Vice-President JD Vance

title: Maharashtra rains: CM seeks ‘substantial’ Central assistance
description: Death toll rises to 86; Fadnavis submits a two-page memorandum to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, stating that the govt. has approved ₹2,215 crore from the SDRF, but it could be ‘inadequate’

title: Defence ministry inks deal with HAL for 97 more Tejas jets
description: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) secured a Rs 66,500-crore contract to deliver 97 Tejas Mark-1A fighters to the Indian Air Force (IAF) starting 2027-28. This follows delays in the delivery of the initial 83 jets ordered in 2021, primarily due to delayed engine supplies from General Electric. HAL anticipates delivering two aircraft next month, with GE promising increased engine deliveries soon.

title: Derby in Super Cup group stage as Mohun Bagan, East Bengal drawn together
description: The traditional giants have been placed in Group A alongside Chennaiyin FC and Real Kashmir FC, setting the stage for a high-voltage clash, which is likely to be held at the Fatorda Stadium in Margao on October 31

title: Deep Tech startup Welkinrim raises ₹4.76 crore
Officials say 911 emergency lines down across Mississippi and Louisiana
description: The Emergency Communications Center for New Orleans said on its social media page that the outage was due to the cutting of a 911 “fiber line.”

title: Madison Beer opens up on dating struggles, feeling unsafe after breakups
description: Rumors of a romance between Los Angeles Chargers' quarterback Justin Herbert and pop star Madison Beer have ignited fan frenzy. Despite being spotted on dates, both stars remain tight-lipped. Beer's past comments about finding love have resurfaced, contrasting with Herbert's denial of any romantic involvement, fueling further speculation as Beer is seen supporting him at games.

title: On Devi Lal birth anniversary, INLD takes the fight to the Hoodas in Rohtak
description: Mr. Chautala promised to provide free electricity and double the old age pension on returning to power

title:
Delhi govt., IIT Kanpur sign
MoU for artificial rain trials
description: Five trials planned from October 7-11 as emergency measure to combat rising air pollution; historic milestone, says CM; Sirsa alleges inaction by previous AAP govt.; experts warn against ‘quick fixes’

title: Chinese Premier says U.S. and his country need to 'work in same direction'
description: It is essential to American interests that business leaders and policy experts have the opportunity to discuss key issues, address concerns and maintain working relationships with Chinese leaders, says committee President Stephen Orlins

title: Fresh charges of fraud, forgery emerge against institute chief accused of sexual harassment
description: The FIR accessed by The Hindu reveals that the accused installed multiple CCTV cameras inside the women’s hostel citing “security” reasons.

title: 50% of U.P. industries flout norms: report on Ganga pollution
Court reserves order on bail of accused in car crash case

description: The HPV vaccine will be available on Vidal Health’s digital platform. It will enable digital registration, cashless payment and automated tracking of the multi-dose vaccine schedule.

Robinson, now in custody, faces multiple charges, including aggravated murder, with prosecutors seeking the death penalty.

title: Andre Agassi & Steffi Graf net worth 2025: Legacy, family & fortune
description: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf, tennis legends with a combined fortune of $290 million in 2025, continue to impact the sport. Agassi captained Team World to victory at the Laver Cup, while Graf dedicates her time to family and charitable endeavors. Their children, Jaden and Jaz, were seen supporting their father at the Laver Cup, highlighting their enduring family legacy.
